headline: New MetLife Data Finds Rising Cost Pressures Outpacing Gains in Workforce Well‑Being
summary: NEW YORK, January 07, 2026--According to new MetLife research, less than half of America’s workforce is holistically healthy as employees battle rising costs and employers balance investing in benefits with broader cost-cutting measures. These early findings from MetLife’s 2026 U.S. Employee Benefit Trends Study underscore the challenge of sustaining workforce well-being and engagement in an environment where both employees and employers are financially strained.

headline: MetLife (MET) Valuation Check As Dividend And Buybacks Reinforce Long Term Shareholder Return Focus
summary: MetLife (MET) has reaffirmed its first quarter 2026 common stock dividend at US$0.5675 per share, along with an ongoing stock buyback program, reinforcing its focus on shareholder cash returns and income-oriented investors. See our latest analysis for MetLife. MetLife’s share price sits at US$81.18 after a 1-day share price return of a 0.72% decline, alongside a recent drop in short interest and ongoing buybacks that signal shifting risk perceptions, while a 5-year total shareholder return of...
